item.title: BiomechAgent: AI-Assisted Biomechanical Analysis Through Code-Generating Agents
item.description: arXiv:2602.06975v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Markerless motion capture is making quantitative movement analysis increasingly accessible, yet analyzing the resulting data remains a barrier for clinicians without programming expertise. We present BiomechAgent, a code-generating AI agent that enabl...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> retrieval, model, reasoning, analysis, prompt | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Equipping LLM with Directional Multi-Talker Speech Understanding Capabilities
item.description: arXiv:2602.07211v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent studies have demonstrated that prompting large language models (LLM) with audio encodings enables effective speech understanding capabilities. However, most speech LLMs are trained on single-channel, single-talker data, which makes it challengi...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> large language model, prompting, model, audio, prompt | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: ANCHOR: Branch-Point Data Generation for GUI Agents
item.description: arXiv:2602.07153v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: End-to-end GUI agents for real desktop environments require large amounts of high-quality interaction data, yet collecting human demonstrations is expensive and existing synthetic pipelines often suffer from limited task diversity or noisy, goal-drift...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> demonstration, model, experiment, framework, vision | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: AVERE: Improving Audiovisual Emotion Reasoning with Preference Optimization
item.description: arXiv:2602.07054v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Emotion understanding is essential for building socially intelligent agents. Although recent multimodal large language models have shown strong performance on this task, two key challenges remain - spurious associations between emotions and irrelevant...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> multimodal, release, large language model, ICL, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.
item.description: "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy.
